intro: Onosma pyrenaica, commonly known as the Pyrenean hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Iberian Peninsula and southern France. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. Its yellow flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer, are surrounded by narrow, linear leaves. Onosma pyrenaica is relatively small, usually reaching heights of less than 30 centimeters, and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
